sailpoint.object

Class ObjectConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.tools.xml.AbstractXmlObject
      • sailpoint.object.SailPointObject
        • sailpoint.object.ObjectConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Cacheable, sailpoint.tools.xml.PersistentXmlObject, sailpoint.tools.xml.XMLReferenceTarget

    public class ObjectConfig
extends SailPointObject
implements java.lang.Cloneable, Cacheable
    Class used to encapsulate configuration options for a particular subclass of SailPointObject. The primary purpose is to maintain a list of ObjectAttribute definitions that define the extended and searchable attributes of the class. Additional configuration can be placed in a map.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getCache

        public static CacheReference getCache(java.lang.Class cls)
        Called in various classes to get the static configuration cache for that class. A CacheReference object is returned and can be used indefinitely.

      • getCustomAttributes

        public java.util.List<ObjectAttribute> getCustomAttributes()
        Return a list of the custom attributes. These are also by definition searchable.

      • getExtendedAttributeList

        public java.util.List<ObjectAttribute> getExtendedAttributeList()
        Return only the extended attribute definitions. These are custom searchable attributes, and include both those with a numbered column assignment, or with a named column mapping. A better name would be getCustomSearchableAttributes()

      • getMultiAttributeList

        public java.util.List<ObjectAttribute> getMultiAttributeList()
        Return a list of attribute definitions that are multi-valued.

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,ObjectAttribute> getTargetedAttributes()
        Return a map of attribute definitions that have targets, keyed by name.

        public Attributes<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getDefaultValues()
        This will return only the attributes that can have default values. Override in subclass to change this.

      • hasObjectAttribute

        public boolean hasObjectAttribute(java.lang.String name)
        Determines if an object attribute with the specified name exists.
        Parameters:
        name - The object attribute name.
        Returns:
        True if the object attribute exists, false otherwise.

        A commonly used accessor for an ObjectAttribute display name.

      • getObjectAttributeWithSource

        public ObjectAttribute getObjectAttributeWithSource(Application app,
                                                    java.lang.String attrName)
        A helper to return an ObjectAttribute that is sourced by the given attribute on the given application.
        Parameters:
        app - The application from which the attribute is sourced.
        attrName - The name of the attribute on the given application from which the attribute is sourced.

      • getObjectAttributesByApplication

        public java.util.Collection<ObjectAttribute> getObjectAttributesByApplication(Application app)
        A helper that returns the ObjectAttributes that source the given application. Unmapped ObjectAttributes are considered to source all applications.
        Parameters:
        app - Application that sources the ObjectAttributes being queried
        Returns:
        Collection of ObjectAttributes that source the given application. If none are found an empty Collection is returned

      • getObjectAttribute

        public ObjectAttribute getObjectAttribute(int number)
        Lookup an attribute by extended number. This is only for use during promotion of attributes from the map to the number columns during a Hibernate flush.
